alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 2:10PM MDT until June 04 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following county, Phillips. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 158 PM MDT, Officials from the CMR National Wildlife Refuge advised that Rock Creek Road is closed due to wash out from recent heavy rainfall. - Though no update has been providing flooding in this area, local streams and creeks continue to respond to runoff from days of heavy rainfall. Washed out roads continue to be a concern in this area. Precipitation through tomorrow will be less than in the last few days, though a localized thunderstorm may produce brief heavy downpours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Phillips County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
